oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Saturation and geometrical scaling -- from small $x$ deep inelastic ep scattering to high energy proton-proton and heavy ion collisions
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Praszalowicz, Michal
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: High Energy Physics - Phenomenology
Nuclear Theory
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Gluon distributions of colliding hadrons saturate as a result of the non-linear evolution equations of QCD. As a consequence there exists the so called saturation momentum, which is related to the gluon density per unit rapidity per transverse area. When saturation momentum is the only scale for physical processes, different observables exhibit geometrical scaling (GS). We show a number of examples of GS and its violation in different reactions.

Comment: 7 pages, 4 figures, Presented at the XXIII International Workshop on Deep Inelastic Scattering and Related Subjects, April 27 - May 1, 2015, Southern Methodist University, Dallas, Texas 75275. PoS(DIS2015)084
